message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sperm granuloma is a potential complication of vasectomy, where sperm leak into the tissue causing inflammation and a small lump. Seminoma is a type of testicular cancer but it is not related to vasectomy. Inguinal hernia and prostatitis are also not directly related to vasectomy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sperm granuloma is a common complication of vasectomy, occurring in up to 30% of cases. Seminoma, inguinal hernia, and prostatitis are not directly related to vasectomy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sperm granuloma is a possible complication of a vasectomy, which is characterized by the accumulation of sperm in the epididymis leading to inflammation and granuloma formation. None of the other options are directly related to vasectomy as a procedure.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. After a vasectomy, an inflammatory reaction may occur resulting in a sperm granuloma, a benign lump containing sperm cells. Seminoma is a type of testicular cancer and inguinal hernia and prostatitis are not common complications after vasectomy.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Vasectomy may cause sperm granuloma, which occurs in up to 30% of patients. None of the other options are directly related to vasectomy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sperm granuloma is a common complication of vasectomy, where sperm leaks from the vas deferens and causes a granulomatous inflammatory response. None of the other answer choices are associated with vasectomy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. After vasectomy, sperm granuloma is a common complication that occurs in up to 30% of patients. Seminoma, inguinal hernia, and prostatitis are not directly related to vasectomy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Vasectomy can lead to the development of sperm granuloma, which is a rounded swelling containing sperm and inflammatory cells. None of the other options are related to vasectomy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Vasectomy may lead to the formation of a sperm granuloma, which is a small lump that forms because sperm leak into surrounding tissue. The other options are not commonly associated with vasectomy.

We refer to medical websites for help. Sperm granuloma is a common complication of vasectomy, occurring in around 15% of patients. Seminoma or inguinal hernia are not known complications of vasectomy. Prostatitis may be associated with urinary tract infections but is not directly related to vasectomy.
